newsitem.title: JAPAN: Most units sharply higher vs yen in crosses.
newsitem.headline: Most units sharply higher vs yen in crosses.

text.p: Most units rose sharply against the yen in Tokyo cross-trading by late Wednesday, especially the pound, which roared to 200 yen by late afternoon, its highest level since October 1992.

Dealers said aggressive buying of sterling for yen was triggered by major domestic securities houses, mainly related to fresh dual-currency bond issues. Individual investors, who are fed up with low interest rates in Japan, remain keen to invest in higher-yielding instruments, they added.
An apparent shift from Australian dollar assets to sterling-denominated assets was also behind sterling's gains.
